sections.title: Fast, Safe Spring Replacement — Done Right
sections.content:
Garage door springs are under extreme tension and should only be handled by trained professionals. Our team replaces both torsion and extension springs using **high-quality, manufacturer-approved parts** designed for durability and long service life.

We don’t cut corners or replace only half the system when it’s unsafe to do so. Every repair includes proper balancing, correct tensioning, and a full safety inspection to ensure smooth, reliable operation.

sections.title: Why Garage Door Springs Break
sections.content: Garage door springs wear out over time due to daily use, temperature changes, and door weight. Heavier doors, frequent opening cycles, and improperly sized springs can all shorten spring lifespan. When a spring reaches the end of its cycle life, failure often happens suddenly and without warning.

sections.title: Signs You Have a Broken Garage Door Spring
sections.content:
* Garage door won’t open or only opens a few inches  
* Door feels unusually heavy when lifting manually  
* Loud bang or snapping sound from the garage  
* Crooked or uneven door movement  
* Visible gap in the spring

If you’re experiencing any of these issues, **stop using the door immediately** and contact a professional.

faqs.question: How do I know if my garage door spring is broken?
faqs.answer: Common signs include a garage door that won’t open, opens only a few inches, feels extremely heavy, or makes a loud bang when it fails. You may also see a visible gap in the spring above the door. If you notice any of these symptoms, stop using the door and contact a professional.

faqs.question: Can I open my garage door with a broken spring?
faqs.answer: It’s not recommended. A broken spring puts excessive strain on the opener and can cause further damage or serious injury. In most cases, the door is unsafe to lift manually without proper equipment and training.

faqs.question: How long does garage door spring repair take?
faqs.answer: Most broken spring repairs are completed in under one hour. Our technicians carry the proper tools and replacement springs to restore safe operation during the same visit.

faqs.question: Do both garage door springs need to be replaced?
faqs.answer: If your door uses two springs, replacing both at the same time is strongly recommended. Springs wear evenly, and replacing only one often leads to imbalance and another failure shortly after.

faqs.question: What type of garage door springs do you replace?
faqs.answer: We replace both torsion and extension springs for residential and commercial garage doors. All replacements use manufacturer-approved springs designed for long-term reliability.

faqs.question: Is broken garage door spring repair dangerous?
faqs.answer: Yes. Garage door springs are under extreme tension and can cause serious injury if handled improperly. Spring repair should only be performed by trained professionals with the correct tools and experience.

faqs.question: Will my garage door opener be damaged if I keep using it with a broken spring?
faqs.answer: Yes. Operating a garage door with a broken spring places extreme strain on the opener and can cause motor, gear, or rail failure. We recommend stopping use immediately and scheduling professional repair.

faqs.question: How much does broken spring repair cost?
faqs.answer: Pricing depends on the size, type, and weight of the garage door, as well as the number of springs required. Garage Cowboy provides clear, upfront pricing before any work begins—no hidden fees.

faqs.question: Do you offer emergency garage door spring repair?
faqs.answer: Yes. We provide after-hours emergency broken spring repair throughout DFW at no additional charge, so you’re never stuck with a door you can’t safely use.
